data.question: What is the chemical formula for the coordination polymer synthesized from H3CAM and Gd(NO3)3・6H2O?
What temperature was used to synthesize {[Co0.5(H2O)3][Gd(CAM)(HCAM)2Co1.5(H2O)3]}n·3nH2O?
What is the yield percentage based on Gd for the synthesis of {[Co0.5(H2O)3][Gd(CAM)(HCAM)2Co1.5(H2O)3]}n·3nH2O?
What transformation occurs to the coordination polymer when heated at 369K under a nitrogen atmosphere?
data.answer: Transformation from single crystal 1 to single crystal 2

data.question: What is the ratio of Gd to Co in the coordination polymer after heating at 413K under nitrogen atmosphere?
Is the crystal system of [Gd(H2CAM)3]·14.25H2O trigonal?
Does the volume of the crystal cell decrease when the temperature reaches 413 K?
Is the color change from pink to lavender at 369 K indicative of the formation of compound 2?
Does the guest Co2+ ion remain in the center of the cavity in all transformations?
Is the DRUV-vis spectrum of compound 1 identical to that of compound 3?
What is the crystal size of [Gd(H2CAM)3]·14.25H2O?
What is the final R index for compound 1?
What happens to the coordination polymer when exposed to water vapor at room temperature after heating to 413 K?
data.answer: It changes from violet back to pink, reverting to its original structure.

data.question: Is the transformation from compound 3 back to compound 1 reversible?
Does the transformation process involve a change in the coordination environment of Co2+ ions?
What is the space group of compound 3?
What is the calculated density (g/cm3) of compound 2?
What is the significance of the color change observed during the SC-SC transformation?
data.answer: It indicates the different statuses of the coordination polymer and the movement of the Co2+ ion.

data.question: Can the structure of the coordination polymer remain intact after ten cycles of the SC-SC transformation?
Is the guest water molecule disordered to two positions in compounds 1 and 2?
